hypothesis_content.title: Multi-Catalyst Convergence Amplification in Neutral Regime
hypothesis_content.statement: When two or more major catalysts (CPI/ETF/Options) occur within 72 hours during NEUTRAL regime, the second catalyst's price impact will amplify by 1.5-2x the typical reaction, as cumulative positioning adjustments compound.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes feature balanced positioning. Sequential catalysts force incremental positioning adjustments that compound. Recent CPI whipsaw + ETF outflows + options expiry cluster shows this amplification potential.
entry_conditions: Catalyst A occurs (CPI/ETF flow report/large options expiry)
Catalyst B occurs within 72 hours of A
BTC reacts directionally to A (≥1.5% move)
Enter in same direction as A's reaction 1 hour before Catalyst B

exit_conditions.take_profit: Move equal to 1.8x A's reaction magnitude
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price reverses through A's reaction midpoint

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: In >60% of qualifying events, B's reaction magnitude <1.2x A's reaction OR shows reversal instead of amplification.
